markdownRemark.html:
To be honest this website is my first experience with GatsbyJS and also I am still mastering React. So I’ve discovered, learned and understood a lot of interesting things while building it. This post is my attempt to to document what I’ve learned on the road.

  • Typography.js

    Here is pretty good high level explanation of the concenpts: http://kyleamathews.github.io/typography.js/what/

    Quick summary:

    • scale identifies the relationship between elements, for example is p is 16px, and ration is 2, then h1 is 32

    • one rhythm is equal to one line-height

    • vertical rhythm - margin bottom 1 rhythm on all elements

  • Redux in Gatsby

  • Organize CSS properties

  • Layout Helper Lib - Grid

frontmatter.title: On road learnings
frontmatter.description: (WIP) What I've learnet while building this blog with GatsbyJS
